name: A Peach's Pilgrimage
description:
A Peach's Pilgrimage

Guide a peach away from it's tree to search for better soils. Roll your way through a relaxing and colorful world as you search for the perfect place to spread your... roots. But be careful, the journey isn't a cakewalk, and what's more vulnerable than a peach?

Controls:
A and D or Left and Right Arrow Keys
Jump: W or Up Arrow
Quit: P or Escape [There is no pause Button] [Also it only quits if you're playing the downloaded windows build]

Tested with Xbox Controller and it works!

This game was made under the restrictions set in place by the Global Game Jam and therefore was made in the span of 48 Hours in one weekend. It was made in person in Green Bay Wisconsin at the GBGJ site. It was made in unreal engine and runs both on Windows and through a web browser (NOT MOBILE WEB BROWSER)

Features:

  • A whole 2 Stages
  • Minimal UI and Dialogue
  • Glorious 2.5D Graphics
  • 2 Original Songs made during the jam
  • A Lumpy Peach :P

Credits:

  • Daniel Haller - Programming, Music (made one 3d model)
  • Mary Benetti - 2D and 3D design, Level Design
  • Henry Stirk - Level design, picked up burgers,
  • Richmond Vang - 3D design
